results.title: Two and Two
results.creator_credit: Babak Anvari, Kit Fraser and Flick Art
results.brief_description: In a school governed by a strict regime, the pupils are informed that what they had always been taught as fact is no longer true. But when the incredulous students speak out, they are forced to question how far they will go to stand up for their beliefs.

results.title: Two-lane blacktop [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Monte Hellman, Michael S Laughlin and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: A young driver and his mechanic in a souped-up 1955 Chevrolet, living off drag racing bets in the south west, establish a tentative relationship with a girl who tags on to them. They become involved in an indeterminate cross-country race with the middle-aged driver of a new Pontiac GTO. Like other Hellman films, Two-lane Blacktop is a genre film in which the popular elements are not exploited to satisfy audience expectations but are subverted into fresh patterns. This makes it the most determinedly original of the post-Easy Rider road movies, an existential parable which makes striking use of widescreen compositions, long takes and elliptical cuts while denying narrative tension. Instead there is the resonance of character and situation. Hellman has described the film as ‘a love story (about) … how much romance is left in a non-romantic world’, but this is implicit. Cast includes: James Taylor, Warren Oates, Laurie Bird, Dennis Wilson. Also available on VHS.

results.title: Two-colour separation studies
results.brief_description: A variety of still life, landscape and portrait studies in both red/green and orange/blue systems are accompanied by a detailed explanation by Arthur Cantrill of the process and history of the two colour separation system. Includes a simulation of the Kinemacolour process which alternated red and green frames.

results.title: Twister
results.creator_credit: Constant c Productions, Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Warner Bros. Pictures, Kathleen Kennedy, Jan de Bont, Joseph C. Nemec III, Ellen Mirojnick, Michael Crichton, Ian Bryce, Anne-Marie Martin and Ken Nielsen
results.brief_description: TV weatherman Bill Harding is trying to get his tornado-hunter wife, Jo, to sign divorce papers so he can marry his girlfriend Melissa. But Mother Nature, in the form of a series of intense storms sweeping across Oklahoma, has other plans.

constellations_other.name: Representing disasters
constellations_other.description: The devastating Indian Ocean tsunami was captured by many people on personal devices and home cameras, with the footage broadcast to the world. The event also inspired feature films that are part of a long tradition of disaster films, which often push the boundaries of VFX.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Constant c Productions, Universal Pictures, Amblin Entertainment, Warner Bros. Pictures, Kathleen Kennedy, Jan de Bont, Joseph C. Nemec III, Ellen Mirojnick, Michael Crichton, Ian Bryce, Anne-Marie Martin and Ken Nielsen
results.description: TV weatherman Bill Harding is trying to get his tornado-hunter wife, Jo, to sign divorce papers so he can marry his girlfriend Melissa. But Mother Nature, in the form of a series of intense storms sweeping across Oklahoma, has other plans. Soon the three have joined the team of stormchasers as they attempt to insert a revolutionary measuring device into the very heart of several extremely violent tornados.

results.title: Twins: matching genes
results.creator_credit: Heather Cook and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Examines the progress made since 1936 when Dr Norma Ford Walker established a Twin Register: explains how fraternal and identical twins develop; shows a close examination of the placentas of twins; observes the behaviour of a set of identical twins; and concludes with a pair of identical twins separated shortly after birth reminiscing about their discovery of each other after twenty-four years. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Twinkle twinkle
results.brief_description: A colour hand-drawn animation in response to the theme washing machine depicts the story of a little girl Emily in the home of arguing parents. She reads, plays and sings in a make-shift cubby house - a box that held the new washing machine - and lives a fantasy life to escape her arguing parents.

results.title: Twin Peaks: fire walk with me
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Gregg Fienberg and Twin Peaks Productions
results.brief_description: David Lynch’s prequel to the cult television series, “Twin Peaks”, depicts the last seven days in the life of Laura Palmer, whose plastic-wrapped corpse was found floating in the river in the introduction of the TV series. In the quiet town of Twin Peaks, Laura is the popular prom queen by day. By night, however, she is the sex-crazed cokehead who prostitutes herself to support her drug habit. Her race to oblivion is escalated further by an awareness of sexual abuse which has been taking place since she was a child. Cast includes: Sheryl Lee, Ray Wise, Moira Kelly, Harry Dean Stanton, Kyle MacLachlan, Kiefer Sutherland, James Marshall, Grace Zabriskie, Pam Gidley, David Lynch, David Bowie and Chris Isaak.

results.title: Twin Peaks. Season one. Eps 5 and 6 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Caleb Deschanel, Lesli Glatter, Gregg Fienberg, Frost Productions and Lynch/Frost Productions
results.brief_description: EPISODE FIVE: In this episode, Agent Cooper and Sheriff Truman discover several new leads which point to the involvement of Leo Johnson and Jacques Renault in Laura’s murder. Audrey Horne continues to provide more unexpected assistance to the investigation as she infiltrates the nearby brothel, One-Eyed Jacks, in an effort to impress Agent Cooper. Meanwhile, Donna forms a new bond with James Hurley and Madeline, while Laura’s father, Leland Palmer, becomes even more unhinged. EPISODE SIX: Agent Cooper and Big Ed Hurley, James’ uncle, go undercover at the casino and brothel, One-Eyed Jacks, unaware of Audrey’s similar plans. Meanwhile James Hurley and Donna Hayward, suspicious of Laura’s psychiatrist, Dr. Jacoby, decide to lay a trap for him by disguising Madeline as Laura, back from the dead. Cast includes: Madchen Amick, Dana Ashbrook, Richard Beymer, Lara Flynn Boyle, Sherilyn Fenn, Warren Frost, Peggy Lipton, James Marshall, Everett McGill, Jack Nance, Ray Wise, Joan Chen, Piper Laurie, Eric Da Re, Harry Goaz, Michael Horse, Sheryl Lee, Russ Tamblyn, Grace Zabriskie, Miguel Ferrer, Walter Oklexicz, Royce D. Applegate and Kyle MacLachlan.

results.title: Twin Peaks. Season one. Eps 5-7 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mark Frost, Caleb Deschanel, Lesli Glatter, Gregg Fienberg, Frost Productions and Lynch/Frost Productions
results.brief_description: Ep 5: In this episode, Agent Cooper and Sheriff Truman discover several new leads which point to the involvement of Leo Johnson and Jacques Renault in Laura’s murder. Audrey Horne continues to provide more unexpected assistance to the investigation as she infiltrates the nearby brothel, One-Eyed Jacks, in an effort to impress Agent Cooper. Meanwhile, Donna forms a new bond with James Hurley and Madeline, while Laura’s father, Leland Palmer, becomes even more unhinged. Ep 6: Agent Cooper and Big Ed Hurley, James’ uncle, go undercover at the casino and brothel, One-Eyed Jacks, unaware of Audrey’s similar plans. Meanwhile James Hurley and Donna Hayward, suspicious of Laura’s psychiatrist, Dr. Jacoby, decide to lay a trap for him by disguising Madeline as Laura, back from the dead. Ep 7: The final episode of the first season sees the climax of several important plotlines. Donna and James’ trap for Dr. Jacoby backfires after he is beaten and has a heart attack. Agent Cooper’s undercover infiltration of One-Eyed Jacks leads to a telling encounter with Jacques Renault, who confesses to his activities on the night of Laura’s murder. Meanwhile, Leo Johnson sets fire to the mill with his wife inside, unknowing of the plans for his own demise.

results.title: Twin Peaks. Season one. Eps 1 and 2 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Duwayne Dunham, Gregg Fienberg, Frost Productions and Lynch/Frost Productions
results.brief_description: EPISODE ONE: In this first instalment, FBI Agent Dale Cooper continues in his investigation of the death of Laura Palmer. An autopsy reveals a few unexpected clues relating to Laura’s actions on the night of her murder. Meanwhile, the first suspect, Laura’s secret lover James Hurley, is released from custody, while several other people are questioned regarding their relations with Laura. EPISODE TWO: Agent Cooper turns to unconventional criminology methods, lecturing the local Sheriff’s office on the wisdom of Tibet. Several important plot threads are also revealed in this episode, while a new and uneasy friendship forms between the sultry and spoilt Audrey Horne and Laura’s best friend, Donna Hayward. This episode, directed by Lynch himself, ends with the much discussed surreal dream sequence where Agent Cooper encounters strange figures such as the One-Armed Man, the Magician, the dancing Man from Another Place and Laura Palmer herself. Cast includes: Madchen Amick, Dana Ashbrook, Richard Beymer, Lara Flynn Boyle, Sherilyn Fenn, Warren Frost, Peggy Lipton, James Marshall, Everett McGill, Jack Nance, Ray Wise, Joan Chen, Piper Laurie, Eric Da Re, Harry Goaz, Michael Horse, Sheryl Lee, Russ Tamblyn, Grace Zabriskie, Miguel Ferrer, Walter Oklexicz, Royce D. Applegate and Kyle MacLachlan.
